definitions.definition: The numeric symbol that represents the cardinal number zero .
examples: In unary and k-adic notation in general, zero is the empty string.
Write 0.0 to indicate a floating point number rather than the integer zero .
The zero sign in American Sign Language is considered rude in some cultures.

definitions.definition: The digit 0 in the decimal , binary , and all other base numbering systems.

examples: The shipment was lost, so they had zero in stock.
In the end, all of our hard work amounted to zero .

definitions.definition: The value of a magnitude corresponding to the cardinal number zero.
examples: The electromagnetic field does not drop all of the way to zero before a reversal.

definitions.definition: The point on a scale at which numbering or measurement originates.
examples: The temperature outside is ten degrees below zero .

definitions.definition: A value of the independent variables of a function, for which the function is equal to zero.
examples: The zeroes of a polynomial are its roots by the fundamental theorem of algebra.
The derivative of a continuous, differentiable function that twice crosses the axis must have a zero .
The nontrivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function may all lie on the critical line.

definitions.definition: The additive identity element of a monoid or greater algebraic structure , particularly a group or ring .
examples: Since a commutative zero is the inverse of any additive identity, it must be unique when it exists.
The zero (of a ring or field) has the property that the product of the zero with any element yields the zero .
The quotient ring over a maximal ideal is a field with a single zero element.

definitions.definition: A person of little or no importance .
examples: They rudely treated him like a zero .

definitions.definition: A Mitsubishi A6M Zero , a long range fighter aircraft operated by the Imperial Japanese Navy Air Service from 1940 to 1945.
A setting of calibrated instruments such as a firearm , corresponding to a zero value.
A security which has a zero coupon (paying no periodic interest).
examples: The takeovers were financed by issuing zeroes .

main_definition: The numeric symbol that represents the cardinal number zero .
secondary_definitions: The digit 0 in the decimal , binary , and all other base numbering systems.
The value of a magnitude corresponding to the cardinal number zero.
The point on a scale at which numbering or measurement originates.
( mathematics ) A value of the independent variables of a function, for which the function is equal to zero.
( mathematics , algebra ) The additive identity element of a monoid or greater algebraic structure , particularly a group or ring .
( slang ) A person of little or no importance .
( military , usually capitalized ) A Mitsubishi A6M Zero , a long range fighter aircraft operated by the Imperial Japanese Navy Air Service from 1940 to 1945.
A setting of calibrated instruments such as a firearm , corresponding to a zero value.
( finance ) A security which has a zero coupon (paying no periodic interest).
